BitTorrent

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • BitTorrent.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents message types sent between two peers through a stream of bytes.
    Author:
    Amulya Uppala, Jewel Lim, Truong Pham

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      byte id
      The message id byte.
      int lengthPrefix
      Specifies the length of the message
      byte[] message
      The byte array that stores the message to send to peer.
      static byte MSG_BITFIELD
      The message id byte that pertains to bitfield when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_CHOKE
      The message id byte that pertains to choke when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_HAVE
      The message id byte that pertains to have when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_INTERESTED
      The message id byte that pertains to interested when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_KEEP_ALIVE
      The message id byte that pertains to keep alive when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_NOT_INTERESTED
      The message id byte that pertains to not interested when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_PIECE
      The message id byte that pertains to piece when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_REQUEST
      The message id byte that pertains to request when communicating with peer.
      static byte MSG_UNCHOKE
      The message id byte that pertains to unchoke when communicating with peer.

      • Message

        public Message(int lengthPrefix,

        Parameters:

        msgID - This method is the constructor specifies the different message types sent between two peers.

    • Method Detail

      • setPayload

        public void setPayload(int index,
                       int begin,
                       int length,
                       byte[] bitfield)
        Parameters:
        Index - integer specifying the zero-based piece index
        begin - zero-based byte offset within the piece
        block - integer specifying the requested length This method sets the payload for messages that are type HAVE, REQUEST, or PIECE. If it is not one of those messages, it outputs an error. Payloads are specific bytes that are added onto have, piece and request messages that describe the data.
